title: Winters' Formula for Metabolic Acidosis Compensation
desc: The Winters’ Formula for Metabolic Acidosis Compensation Calculates the expected pCO<sub>2</sub> compensation in a purely metabolic acidosis

orgreference.text: Albert MS, Dell RB, Winters RW. Quantitative Displacement of Acid-Base Equilibrium in Metabolic Acidosis. Ann Intern Med. 1967;66:312-322. doi:10.7326/0003-4819-66-2-312.

other_refer.text: Adrogué HJ, Madias NE. Secondary responses to altered acid-base status: the rules of engagement. J Am Soc Nephrol. 2010;21(6):920-3.

data.evidence:
Expected pCO₂ = 1.5 x HCO3- + 8 ± 2

Note: although the original Winters formula used a standard error of ±2, newer data suggest that pCO₂ may vary up to ±5 (Adrogué and Madias 2010).
